sit up.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to be in a sitting position or get into a sitting position after you have been lying down
sit up.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: He was sitting up in bed, reading his book.
She sat up and reached for her glass.
sit up.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to help someone to sit after they have been lying down
sit up.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: I’ll sit you up on the pillows and you’ll be nice and comfortable.
sit up.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to sit in a chair with your back straight
sit up.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Just sit up straight and stop slouching.
sit up.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: Sometimes we just sit up and watch videos all night.
sit up.translation[0].definitions[4].def: to suddenly start paying attention to someone, because they have done something surprising or impressive
sit up.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: If Maria succeeded, then everyone would sit up and take notice.
sit up.translation[1].definitions[0].def: an exercise to make your stomach muscles strong, in which you sit up from a lying position, while keeping your feet on the floor
sit up.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Jerry says he does two hundred sit-ups a day.
